website_summaries.verdict: The Fitbit Versa is the best fusion of smartwatch and general fitness tracker under $200, if you can live with its limitations.
pros: The Fitbit Versa is a compact, lightweight smartwatch and fitness tracker with an improved interface for easier fitness stat readouts
It’s water-resistant to 50 meters, and works with iOS and Android
Many of the apps and watch faces are useful and fun
Multiday battery life beats the Apple Watch
cons: Its battery life falls short of other Fitbit fitness trackers
The apps and watch faces aren’t always easy to load
Music transfer to the watch is complicated and limited
There's no on-board GPS and the charger is bulky
Tap-to-pay model costs a bit more in the US

customer_reviews.title: Will not update to latest firmware
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with the Fitbit Versa. The first one I ordered did not updated and eventually stopped linking via blue tooth even after resetting it. Got a replacement a few days later and after repeated failures to update on 3 different devices via blue tooth and wifi I'm returning it for a refund. This is the first Fitbit product I've had a problem with.
customer_reviews.author: Mike becker

customer_reviews.title: Quit tracking heart rate and sleep after less than 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it while it worked. My husband bought this for me for Christmas this year and now it's not even the end of March and it will no longer track heart rate or sleep. Apparently this is a common problem that I didn't read about when doing my research so I want others to know about it. I did all the suggested 'fixes' , even a factory reset but nothing helped. Over $200 is a lot of money for something to not even last 3 months! Very disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed, returned within a week. Could not get it to sync with iTunes. I followed the directions to a tee and spoke to customer service more than once. There were other little things that bugged me but I could have gotten over them if the music feature would have worked, but without that, no thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working Within 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this watch in July and it has stopped working already. Very frustrating for the cost of this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Joncee

customer_reviews.title: 7 months in and completely useless
customer_reviews.text: Until a week ago, I would have reviewed the Versa with 5 stars, but then the heart rate tracker stopped giving me accurate readings, making sleep tracking and activity tracking completely useless with the heart rate tracker enabled. The information I can get with it off is no better than a much cheaper and more streamlined device. Customer service has been absolutely no help in 3 interactions, stating that this is a "known issue" with no resolution. My request for a warranty claim was denied since the individual device is not defective. I will no longer recommend the Versa at all!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Linsenbardt

customer_reviews.title: SO disappointed in my Versa
customer_reviews.text: I got the Versa for a Christmas gift. I loved it! Then it stopped keeping track of my sleep and heart rate... no big deal... I love it keeps track of my steps... As soon as we started having warm weather (I live in Houston) I would be outside maybe 2 hrs and my Versas battery would die... I thought it was a fluke. Nope... I was in our backyard today for 2 hrs... the battery was at 40% and 10 min later- completely dead! I don't know if I got a dud or what... but I would not recommend the Versa!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Ringo

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I'm a little disappointed that fitbit hasn't upgraded ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I'm a little disappointed that fitbit hasn't upgraded some programming since my first purchase of a fitbit product 4 years ago. Specifically, there is still not enough choice of activities (e.g. no dancing/aerobics/zumba) nor, apparently, is there any way to import data from other major fitness apps (i.e. samsung gear fit, google fit, huawei fit). Nonetheless, I like the Versa and am super happy I can leave it on in the pool. I would buy it again as long as it lasts longer than the last two fitbit products I had.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Legal False Adverizing. No Sleep Stages. They admit they have, “a bug.” Bug is 3 years old.
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit outside return window, so I am stuck until I have money for Apple Watch, (Refurbished have great reputation, are cheap and they stand behind it.). The Fitbit Versa, advertises it, “Sleep Stages” fearure, loud and clear and It is a deciding factor for many customers. The problem is that there is a bug in it and they admit it openly. They’ve been working on the bug, as they say, for 3 years. If you push them about this business practice, they will tell you that if you thoroughly read the warranty, and the small print, you will see that they do not have to stand behind it. So it amounts to legal, false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: lynne

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Versa Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: Love the Versa but I miss some of the previous features. I wish I could readily see the battery so that I could charge the Fitbit at a convenient time. I missed the walking trails that I could follow alone. New features that are great is seeing calories burned and heart rate is always displayed. I’ve used the coach feature but I’m not fond of it on the Fitbit maybe it’s better on the phone. Not sure why I can answer a call or decline it from my Fitbit since I need the phone to answer a call. A notification is all that’s needed in my opinion. I’m very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E J

customer_reviews.title: This watch is a crap shoot
customer_reviews.text: Reviews are either good or bad. Mine was bad experience. This is my 3rd fitbit watch. The other 2 were good and I would have given them a 5 star rating. The Versa has problems. The crap shoot going from the fitbit communtiy discussions are how bad the problems are and how many of them. The few nice things are it is lighter than my Charge 3 and the charge is more stable. That doesn't justify the price.
customer_reviews.author: Long time user

customer_reviews.title: Does't sync or update
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for a couple of months then it started having problems: the battery life got shorter and shorter. Now I have to recharge it every day. It doesn't sync and I can't update firmware. Amazon doesn't want to refund or replace because it's out of the return window. 200$ down the drain. I should have listened to the bad reviews and not order this.
customer_reviews.author: anonimous

customer_reviews.title: I need some guidance
customer_reviews.text: I been trying to pair my phone to my new watch since I recieved it I have a samsung s7. I had several people try I went to verizon they said there is something wrong with your watch. I was so excited when i recieved it but now it doesn't do anything I really wanted it to do I need some asst on what I should do. I love my watch just very disappointed that it doesn't work properly. If there is any way you can contact me here is my email address msjudi62@cox.net thank you for you time in this matter
customer_reviews.author: Judi Frady

customer_reviews.title: Says water resistant, but obviously not.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in September of 2018. I loved it. It is April 1, 2019 and it no longer is working. I wore it during the day only and at aqua aerobics, in waist high water not in deep water. I’m so disappointed. Several people have bought it on my recommendation, I feel terrible that I recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Love the Versa, had some issues with the products from amazon
customer_reviews.text: I had issues with the first original order and the replacement order from amazon. I contacted fitbit and after a while on customer service they saw that I was shipped one with a bad battery. I suggest just going through FitBit directly to buy but I wanted the 2 day shipping so I went through amazon. The Versa itself is amazing. I love it. I run with it and it tracks all the great stats. Logs sleep perfectly and shows me phone notifications.
customer_reviews.author: Carry

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing!☹️
customer_reviews.text: The fit bit versa is a really nice watch by itself but if you try to take off the band and put another band on, what a nightmare! it is almost impossible to change the bands I do not recommend this product I called Fitbit to try to get my money back after owning their fit bit versa for three months and they told me that they will not take it back! how disappointing. My fingers are sore from trying to put that damn band on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love my fitbit versa. It tracks exercise, sleep, heart beats, menstrual cycle water intake i.e. how much water you drink, you can log what you eat. Powerful and fun. I change my watch faces as often as I like....and my bands. Back to the gym. Got it for Christmas, so I'm gonna rock it. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: PKPR

customer_reviews.title: Failed Big Time
customer_reviews.text: This was a present I gave myself about a year ago. It is now a paperweight. For the first 4-5 months, I was thrilled and then the features that attracted me began to fail. I did not abuse, overuse or in any way do anything but wear it and charge according to manufacturers specs. I had to turn off all the features I bought it for in order to save battery life. But over the next month the battery charge lasted shorter an$ shorter. Now even with all features off, the battery won’t charge long enough to wear it for an hour or two. So disappointed in This product. Doesn’t even last the warranty period, what a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: willandpetesmom

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: i ordered mine on Nov. 30 it only lasted 3 months before the watch broke, i called and got a replacement sent to me which was easy, the replacement broke 4 months later. i went to sleep everything was ok woke up the next day the watch was dead, called wanted my money back, their policy is NOT to give money back all they can do is send me another watch and after that one brakes i am on my own. for something that is expensive it sure has a short shelf life. i should have bought an Apple watch.
customer_reviews.author: Muhiba Smajlagic

customer_reviews.title: DONT BOTHER! Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: DONT BOTHER! What a waste of money and they don’t honor there product. If your out of warranty they won’t work with you. They only offered me 25% off another versa. Not satisfied at all!! I asked if they would take it in and give me a refurbished and they don’t even do that. If you want a tracker get a cheap one that way if it breaks your not out $200.00.
customer_reviews.author: C.S.

customer_reviews.title: versa broke, then the replacement broke
customer_reviews.text: I'm sad to have to write this review, but I ordered the Fitbit Versa in October, and by December, the screen had stopped working, and then eventually, it wouldn't sync with the app. I got a replacement, which I was happy about, it arrived in January, 6-8 weeks later, again, the display broke, this time, however, I am unable to get a replacement. And returning the item isn't an option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Versa for about 4-6 months now. At first I was so happy with it, however lately the battery drains like a hose. I charge it to 100% on an afternoon, and the next morning its already at 50%. I really expected better from FITBIT, considering my Blaze lasted me almost a week. UPDATE*** Battery is worse, I charge it to 100% around 9am and the next morning at 6am it's already at 5%. I even used the dim settings and everything.
customer_reviews.author: C Clark

customer_reviews.title: Love the versa
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fitbit versa. I’ve been using it for 8 months now. It stopped working this week and I contacted their customer service and they are sending a replacement without any hassle at all. I am thrilled with their customer service. I’ve had several fit bits (original, charge, charge HR, and now the versa). They have all been awesome! The versa has been my favorite. I love the rose gold and that it is waterproof. I’m looking forward to having it back again.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: I wore the Apple Watch for a little over a month and hated the health aspect of it
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Versa. After about two months I decided I want an Apple Watch when I ordered my husband one for Father's Day and sold my Versa. I wore the Apple Watch for a little over a month and hated the health aspect of it! I could not adjust to their health app at all. So I ordered another FitBit Versa. I absolutely love the health aspect of the Versa, the battery life, everything. There are certain things I wish I could do on it like I did on the Apple Watch, like answer calls and text messages but I prefer the health much more than the convenience of answering calls and texts.
customer_reviews.author: RobbinsFamily328

customer_reviews.title: Spotty connection and sleep tracking
customer_reviews.text: Constantly a disappointment. I've only had my watch for a little over a month. I am having to restart bluetooth to get it to sync regularly. It also seems to lose my heart rate and therefore, doesn't track my sleep about once a week. It is very disappointing relative to the Alta. I bought it primarily because of the reasonable price and the size. Most other Android smartwatches are too big for my wrist. Update: 7/1/2019 Cannot connect. Lost my watch face. Tried connecting on Pixel 3 and New HD Fire 10--no go. Every morning the watch has been going back to centigrade. This AM no clock face, no apps available. The watch appears worthless!
customer_reviews.author: Nreader

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love
customer_reviews.text: The company I work for has a way to connect fitbit to track steps and there are prizes if you hit your steps. So I looked around for awhile to see which fitbit would be best fitted for me and what I'm wanting to do. So I took the plunge and got the Versa, and I'm in love. I was worried at first because it isn't technically waterproof, but I work in a hospital and seems to do well with the amount of handwashing I do. I wouldn't shower with it on or go swimming. In my opinion I have made an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: MsCrackerJax

customer_reviews.title: Another great product by Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it. This is definitely an upgrade from the blaze. The vibration is strong enough to wake her up in the morning without being overly intrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Williams

customer_reviews.title: Does not Sync with phone leaving features useless
customer_reviews.text: I loved this when I first received and then shortly after features stopped working and it became difficult to sync with phone. It is now 100% unable to sync with my phone and I now own a watch with pedometer feature only--none of the other features work at all. I called Fitbit support and they walked me through several steps that did not work. I am now told that they will contact me through email if they come up with any other troubleshooting options. I received this on August 29 and it is now November 20--my $200 investment did not last long at all. Should have bought a Garmin!!! I am so frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: Robin kelly

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is terrible
customer_reviews.text: It was ok for a few days then followed by a surprise battery drain - only last for 5-7 hours per charge. Contacted support but not much helpful beside a tons of suggestions to switch off many features (but still not improved). Only now release that how bad this issue among other users from internet, since 7 months back (I should have checked before bought it). Will return this watch after struggles and frustration - wonder why Fitbit cannot fix the issue, while still sale to more people. - Not recommending to buy it until this battery issue gets fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Lasts 1 1/2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 11/18 & was fine, did everything it was suppose to--until it stopped working. First it started mis-calculating steps; next was no heart rate (watch, not me); then clock started showing 2-3 hours off when charged; lastly it just won't charge. I expect more out of a $160 "smart," Researching a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Judith M. John

customer_reviews.title: Works Half the Time
customer_reviews.text: When it works, I like it. The manual screen waking function is faulty- so even though I have it on manual, it constantly lights up. Therefore, I can’t wear it to track my sleep because it’s brightness is distracting. It doesn’t connect to the app half the time. It just suddenly stops and then I have to remove the Versa and add it back- a huge pain. Oftentimes I have to attempt two or three times to even get it to sync with my Versa. Today, after 4 attempts, I gave up. It’s such a waste of time and effort. Save your $200.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this MMay 2018. Almost a year to the day in May 2019, it began to rapidly lose charge until it wouldn't keep a charge at all. Contacted FITBIT, they sent me a refurbished watch. Wouldn't you know almost one year to the day, same thing happens. This time they would do nothing except offer me 25% off a a new watch. Are you kidding me? Clearly there's an issue with this watch as it happened twice. Why would I throw good money after bad ti but another one. See ya FITBIT
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: IM Notifications never worked and it just died
customer_reviews.text: I bought this smartwatch back on Aug 6th, 2019. I really loved the design, the functions. It was minimalist; what I was looking for at that time but it was sad realizing the app did not synchronize automatically and notifications never worked. Yesterday I got the notification of low battery, went to charge it but it seems it died just like that. Now I'm trying to get a new charger just to confirm if it is in fact the watch or the charger. Nevertheless, I still feel it is defective. IM notification function does not work. I'm gonna try another brand. I really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Skarling P.

customer_reviews.title: not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I am not impressed by this product at all. I had a charge 2 it was simple and did what it was supposed to. the versa is complicated. I've been setting it up for a week now. it has had syncing issues. I still can't figure out how to add music and even though it's supposed to be able to track elliptical workouts after a minimum of 10 minutes it doesnt always work. flashy, but it's not better than the charge 2
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Don’t even bother. I bought this last year and already had battery problems and they sent me a replacement “upgrade.” Within hours of bringing it to a full charge, and syncing, downloading, etc., the charge is draining fast (down 15% in hours) and the step count is inaccurate. Called customer care and they are sending more instructions for me to do to prove my case... as I did to get the replacement, just frustrating. Should have splurged for an Apple Watch and avoided this nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: GilaMonster

customer_reviews.title: So much battery life!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing ever! I love it so much! I can go up to 4-5 days on one charge! So nice!!! Update: my fitbit started glitching out on me 3 months after buying and ai contacted fitbit support and they were so helpful in trying to figure out the problem and then once they determined that they didnt know what the problem was they are now sending me a complimentary replacement versa. (Also had the option of 50% any fitbit) love fitbit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch face lets you see all of the stats you want to see without having to click through them.
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit Versa arrived earlier than projected when I ordered it. It was easy to transfer from my Charge HR to the Versa. The color is exactly as I expected and the peach band was a nicer shade than it appeared on the internet. I haven't been able to get notifications, e.g. texts and phone calls, to show up on the Versa yet, but I haven't had time to really look into what is the problem. I expect that I have missed turning something on to allow this to work.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: One year later.
customer_reviews.text: *Update. . . Just talk to a Fitbit rep by calling 1-877-623-4997. They are replacing the watch face for free. Now I will give the watch 5 stars. ^One year later. The watch just stopped. I was told to factory rest the versa and now it won’t turn on at all. If I had it to do again I would just pay more and get an I phone and an Apple Watch. I am very sad this broke after one year. I did not get it wet ever and took very good care of it too. I even took it off when I would work out because I did not want to break it. Ugh!! I am so frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: casey hiam

customer_reviews.title: 3rd replacement within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch...as long as it lasts. I am on my 3rd replacement tracker since I purchased the first one since they always had unsolvable issues after some time- from just being dead to not tracking heart rating or no longer syncing right.. The customer service is friendly enough and the replacement process simple- however, since they send you trackers that other customers returned as "replacement" you will most likely end up with a new tracker that has issues soon again. Will play the replacement game until the end of the warranty and after that never buy any Fitbit product again. Too bad since I liked the look and feel
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Stellnberger

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in September 2019 and as of July 2020 the screen is no longer working. No damage to the watch itself. Just woke up one morning and the screen wouldn't work. Attempted all suggested fixes without success. That's a hefty price tag for getting less than a year of use. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!! Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with my versa. I had a charge 2 for a long time and this is such an upgrade. Super comfy and user friendly and it looks really pretty. I love the alarm and all the notifications. The only con i would say is changing the band. I still can't get it figured out and i'm pretty savvy if i may say so myself.
customer_reviews.author: Alina S.

customer_reviews.title: Get a replacement plan
customer_reviews.text: I like my Fitbit, but I’ve had to trade it in twice due to malfunction. I accidentally cracked it in the shower, and the replacement plan sent me a new one immediately. The sleep tracking is the best feature. But I have a lot of problems syncing it with my phone and getting other apps, such as weather, to work on a regular basis. I still can’t get Strava to connect. I will explore other brands once this one officially dies.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Cervone

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first fitness or smart watch and I would say it doesn't disappoint at all. If you are on the look for a fitness tracker/ text and call notification watch look no further. Note this is not like an apple or samsung watch you cannot makes calls or texts and do all those fancy things on it so keep that in mind. As a simple fitness tracker where your able to see all your data on the watch and see your texts and calls as you receive them it is worth every penny. Nice basic fitness watch!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa A

customer_reviews.title: fitbit rushed to put it on market.
customer_reviews.text: Neither hardware or software is well made. Buttons stuck time to time. Bluetooth is not reliable, and built-in music player is a joke. I have owned 3 different fitbit over the passed 4 years, this is the first time felt disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: buzzbuzz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much a cute Smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Super easy to set up, comfortable to wear, & fun to customize! But it isn't very accurate. While driving home one night I got 45 steps in, & its happend on several other occasions. The heart rate monitor cant be correct either, says I have a resting rate of 113 & I'm healthy so i know that cant be correct. But overall im satisfied even if it is basically a cool smart watch!
customer_reviews.author: MomOf1

customer_reviews.title: Better than Apple watch!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Fitbit Versa!!!! It's cute, comfortable, battery lasts me about 5-6 days and I use it alot! Tracks my bpm (heart beats per minute) my steps, my burned calories, my sleeping cycle. And for women it has the option to track the femenine cycle as well, which is nice! I can read my texts and emails from my wrist, and reply from the watch too. Its nice when your phone is all the way at the bottom of your purse or if your hands are full, you can just look at your wrist. You can also customize it with different brands and screen protectors, I wouldn't trade it for a Apple watch! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mari Avila

customer_reviews.title: There are GAMES!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to tell me how much I’m sleeping. Spoiler alert, I’m not and when I do, it’s not very well. Also I’m not active. But... that’s neither here nor there. I don’t have iWatch money, but was jealous of the cool faces and apps... well, the Versa is great! I can reject those calls without picking up my phone (quite discreet when I’m in a meeting), I was able to download a Nightmare Before Christmas face for it (the moon wanes as the battery dies), and there are little games I can play on it. Good alternative to an iWatch, especially when you consider it has a 5 day battery.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rosado

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: This is my third fitbit, and I am in love. Third time is definitely the charm here. Love how it looks and fits. Love the screen and bitmoji watch faces. The fitness tracking features are excellent. Sleep tracking is good, not 100% reliable, but that's a tall order. Battery lasts 3-4 days with consistent wear, which is pretty good! I can get away for the weekend and not bother to bring my charger. Just a few of the many reasons I'm pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anners_03

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a year and a half.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Fitbit but it only lasted a year and a half. I bought this one in December of 2018. I loved it to pieces until I didn’t. The watch suddenly started shutting off randomly and then it shut off and would not restart. :( I have moved on. I have replaced it with and Apple Watch and I’m generally happy. Fitbit beats Apple Watch in battery life, step counting, and sleep monitoring. Apple wins as a smart watch.
customer_reviews.author: Reed

customer_reviews.title: Good watch for fitness tracking
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my wife for her birthday. She loves it. Having previously using a Samsung Wear watch, she absolutely loves not having to be tied to worry whether she would run out of battery before the end of the day. Now she goes multiple days without having to worry about the battery dying. In fact a simple charge when she takes a shower gives her enough charge to last a while.
customer_reviews.author: mahooga

customer_reviews.title: Buy screen protector with it
customer_reviews.text: Loved it much more before the screen got scratched. It has held up for months with nothing so the screen protector I bought for it was forgotten. It works great though...just buy a screen protector with it! I love that it has alarms on it so I don't wake my husband with my loud alarm clock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have a lot of attention to work
customer_reviews.text: Loved what the Versa can do. After 2 weeks the sleep data quit working. I read the internet to try to fix it but... I was so frustrated I was ready to return it. I also had to buy a new, old phone OS wasn't compatible. Thankfully Amazon give the manufacturer's phone number. I'm not the only one to have multiple problems with Versa. After 55 minutes on the phone, 20 minutes on hold Versa worked again. I'm stuck with a phone I don't want & have decided to keep the Versa. Have internet close to look up problems. Frequently must turn off phone, uninstall and reinstall ...
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Love the color
customer_reviews.text: Love the color, the band is amazing you can't even tell you have it on it's so light and soft. The features are decent, I wish it had a speaker so you could listen to your downloaded music with out Bluetooth headphones. The text feature is ok nothing special at all.
customer_reviews.author: Iowa Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love my Fitbit versa
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fitbit versa. I work out several times a week and I love tracking my workout. I also like tracking my sleep and the fact that this Fitbit app also connects to other apps I use (like my fitness pal). I do have trouble with data from the Fitbit app showing in my fitness pal but I’m not sure what the issue is. Also, I like getting call, calendar, and text notifications. You can’t respond to them or answer the phone on the watch, but those weren’t features I was looking for anyway. I mainly wanted something to track workout, calories, sleep, etc. Overall, happy with the purchase and I love the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it. I purchased my watch back in June 2018 and it’s only 5 months old - battery doesn’t even last one day. I fully charge it every morning and it would just die in me early in the evening. The Fitbit team gave me such a hard time when i requested for a new or get my money back but first i had to do all troubleshoots - so i followed their instructions and they still refuse to exchange for a new or give me my money back. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unable to call or respond to texts for IPhone...
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I purchased this was to have text/call accessibility and to have a heart rate monitor... I realized shortly after trying it on that it will show you text messages, but it doesn't let you respond to iPhone messages (I think you can if you are an Android owner). I ended up just saving my money to purchase an Apple watch instead..
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Ok so far so good I love this watch it wakes me up and I love that I can mute it to not get notifications while I’m working out now that’s a plus.UP DATE AS OF TODAY THE HEART MONITOR HAS STOPPED AND AFTER HAVING ONLY 9 months I have done everything to fix the problem I will never buy anything else from this company FITBIT ever again I spent 213.00 on this and now it’s not even worth it at all. Thanks fitnit for the a product that can’t even last a year!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Muscle girl

customer_reviews.title: Definitely waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Great watch. Make sure to get a screen protector for it as the smallest hit will puncture the screen, allthough it still works great. For those of you who are worried about it getting wet, I am a swim teacher and spend 4-8 hours a day in the pool and my watch works perfectly! Pushing the screen in the water is not the easiest but it works as you would expect a wet touch screen to work. It's not the best at counting steps when in the water unless you step down hard (the flex was awesome at step counting in the water) I have had it for a month with no issues from the pool!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: You need one of these if you don’t already have one! It’s literally saving my life!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fitbit!! I recently had two mini strokes and my husband bought me this Fitbit so that I can track my steps, sleep, calories etc and hopefully prevent a stroke in the future. And let me tell you! I’m loving this thing!!!!! ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Keith Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Not up to standards
customer_reviews.text: I loved this at first . Then i realized you can’t play music on it . The Bluetooth connection is so terrible that the music jumps in and out and is impossible to listen to . Then i stopped getting text notifications . I tried everything that online support told me to do . Still not working. So basically i just have a watch that tracks my heart rate and steps . Wish i would have just gotten an Apple Watch
customer_reviews.author: h23

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is HORRIBLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Customer service is HORRIBLE! my Fitbit was replaced once because after 3 months it would no longer sync or receive notifications. It began doing this again april 10th, Fitbit will no longer even respond to my emails about the problem!!! I suspect they are stalling until my warranty ends on may 19th. Horrible horrible way to run a business! Very disappointed and will never ever purchase one of their products again. I now have a Samsung Galaxy smartwatch that works AMAZINGLY! Thanks for nothing but a headache Fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: zombiemom

customer_reviews.title: Best smart watch I have ever owned - better than Pebble, Fossil, and cheaper/smaller than Apple!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for 4 days now. It is tracking my steps perfectly, my sleep pattern, my metabolic calorie burn, reminds me to meditate periodically, reminds me to move every hour so I don't stagnate, looks fantastic on my wrist, and is perfect basically. I am so glad Fitbit bought Pebble, because most of all this reminds me of my much beloved Pebble watch. Last, there's a one dollar watch face from STAR TREK that I bought, so the watch looks even more nerdy like me! :)
customer_reviews.author: cindysilver4

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I did not originally want or need a smart watch, but I do like the versa. I track my water consumption and actually drink more and a result. I try to be more regular with my sleep. And I am always pretty happy when it automatically detects that I am swimming or riding my bike. I did not realize before that I can even check the weather. I like getting text notifications, although I find its ability to answer calls a little silly if I don't have a bluetooth on.
customer_reviews.author: BusyParents

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE  -Love this!
customer_reviews.text: 8/15/19 updated: My watch stopped working today, if the screen lights up it only shows multi-colored lines on it and pushing the reset buttons does not work. Very disappointed! Love this watch. The only thing I have had a problem with is loading music onto it, I don't like that a computer is needed to do so, when all of my music is on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: jodie iverson

customer_reviews.title: Not much in music apps, syncing is a pain. Small and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for a day, but I'm loving it. It's not heavy or bulky and does a lot for it's size. Only reason I did not give it 5 stars was bacause I wish there were more options in Apps for music; I'm hoping that changes in time. I've also been fighting with syncing it to my phone, either with notifications or bluetooth. Not sure if it's me, my phone, or the Versa but it's been annoying regardless. Again, haven't had it for very long, I still have a lot to learn on it and to play with. Overall though I really like it!
customer_reviews.author: Kaz

customer_reviews.title: Quality device
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I do wish it was more of a smart watch. The step counting and sleep tracking arent the most accurate. Im also bummed you cant use pandora with your account if youre not a paid subscriber. The guided exercises are a nice added feature.
customer_reviews.author: SAMANTHA LEHMAN

customer_reviews.title: Needs an easier way to change bands
customer_reviews.text: The watch is great and tracks my info really well. The battery life is fantastic! It did take a LONG time to set up and pair and that was a little bit of a pain. Another pain is taking the bands off to change. I watched several videos on how to remove the band and one side is stuck and will NOT come off. I actually broke the pin and don't I'll be able to change the band at all now. (I used to have an iwatch and one feature I miss was how EASY it was to change the bands... oh well.) They need to come up with another way to change the bands out!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Versa
customer_reviews.text: i Am writing an updated review of the fit bit Versa. Since my purchase in January, I have developed a allergic reaction to the peach band. Also the Versa has stopped monitoring my sleep. I called the Fit Bit company to inquire if they would send me a different band. I received a email response from them and their only option was to refund my money. I have enjoyed the Versa except for these issues. I am disappointed that the only option from the company is to return it.
customer_reviews.author: D. McCaskill

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great smart watch!! I had no problems with it. Nice watch face features. The sleep tracker on it is totally awesome and very informative. It even showed when I was waking up for a minute or two. But in the end I am an Apple gal... UPDATE: unfortunately my Apple Watch doesn’t have sleep tracking so I have to get apps. So far none compare to the Fitbit sleep tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: No Apple Watch but still great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for someone. They love it! I think it works great! I have a Apple Watch. This is not as good. It doesn’t allow the full compatibility to the phone like an Apple Watch. For the money it is almost Apple Watch territory. But it does what it says it does and well.
customer_reviews.author: Caligrown

customer_reviews.title: Great, while she lasted....
customer_reviews.text: The first 28 hours were great. After that, all hell started breaking loose..... 1st - the screen, started blinking [video] off then back on, as if it were trying to go to sleep, then, nope I'm awake. This was hard on the battery life. 100% down to 55% in 6.5 hours. 2nd - it started scrolling, on it's own, through the three items below the clock (BPM, steps, and calories) unfortunately, no video... 3rd - while on the phone with FitBit, the screen started flickering lines and pretty colors [pictures]. Now 4th - its D-E-A-D, dead.. Will update when replacement arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my Fitbit Versa since Christmas. It allows me to read texts, which I like, but since I have an iphone, it doesn’t let me respond on the Fitbit device. Even when I sync the device, the weather app works for a little bit, but doesn’t keep working. I have the settings set to run in the background and it still doesn’t work. It doesn’t register distance when I start the swim function or bike function. It is essentially an expensive watch and pedometer. Pretty disappointed. I tried giving them another try after having another tracker fall apart after warranty. This is the last Fitbit I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in February and it quit working in December. I wear it everyday, but I make sure to take it off when showering; I’ve read too many reviews about it quitting after getting wet. Mine will no longer take a charge, so it completely dead. I’m upgraded to the new Apple Watch, since Google bought out Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: tffnyprkns

customer_reviews.title: Good until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in August of 2019 and it performed great for maybe six months, then it became inconsistent with notifications, screen responsiveness and screen brightness. A year and two months later, it died completely, just outside of the warranty period. This is my 4th Fitbit in 5 years and before I purchased it, I was debating between a Versa and an Apple watch because none of my other three Fitbits lasted very long either. Fitbit's customer service is outstanding and they have always been super responsive and helpful, but unfortunately, the products just don't last long for me and I'm going to put my money into something with a longer life span this time around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Fitbit two weeks ago and today in completely broke. Started with the touch screen not working. I swiped all directions nothing. Now as you can see from my picture the screen doesn't work. The white lines are obviously not supposed to be there. When I looked it up this morning multiple people are having the same issues and Fitbit is being unresponsive. I am returning through Amazon for a refund until they fix this bug. Very disappointed this is my 3rd Fitbit and I never had a problem previously.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but step counting is off
customer_reviews.text: I do love the look and functions of the Versa. The fact it is waterproof is great! My only con is it does not accurately count steps. Somehow I hit 6,000 steps while sitting in my office typing on my laptop and another time while I was driving. I previously had the charge 2 and loooved it...step count was more accurate. But alas because it wasn’t waterproof it took it off to swim and I lost it. Hence upgrading to the versa like I mentioned is nice looking but sucks at counting steps.
customer_reviews.author: Lisette

customer_reviews.title: Buy it-you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Love! I had the Fitbit Blaze for the last few years and constantly ruined and replaced it due to water damage. This time I decided to go to the Versa since it's waterproof and so glad I did. Like the Blazeworh SO MUCH MORE. Love love love! Tracks my fitness, workout, steps, calories and so much more. Haven't figured out how to download music to it but I see the feature in it. Battery lasts about 5 days too, as the Blaze was only 2-3. So happy with my versa!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit has vertical lines issues but company does not care about!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in April 2019. I never showered with it, never got it wet. I never banged it against anything. I always used them with the care. I contacted with Fitbit help and followed all instructions they suggested, did not work out still have stripes. Later I received the email from Fitbit saying that my devise is no longer in the warranty period. They offered 30% discount on some of their old products. I am disappointed and don't suggest to get such watch or make sure to buy warranty. I read on Fitbit forums that vertical lines is the most common issue. Be careful!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daria

customer_reviews.title: Like the product when it works.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product a 2 star rating because I like Fitbit and their products. I just wish they would last longer. I purchased the product in May of 2018. The Versa lasted until December of 2019. Fitbit was fast to respond and to send a replacement. The replacement lasted from December of 2018 to September of 2019. The Replacement died 9 months later. This is past the 12 month warranty period. The best Fitbit could do was to offer a 25% discount. I appreciate the offer for a discount, but I am pretty irritated that two of the same product did not last more than a year. Fitbit Versa 1 lasted 7 Months Fitbit Versa 2 lasted 9 Months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Love what this watch does but it only lasted 11 months before it started doing what my Fit bit ionic did after a year and half. Apps quit connecting like weather. After that they quit syncing with mobile app. Now this one loses time for the last three days in a row. I spend an hour every day last 3 days dicking around with it to work. Great watch if you want to buy new one every year.
customer_reviews.author: Merrylyn Engle

customer_reviews.title: I have been very disappointed in this watch
customer_reviews.text: I have been very disappointed in this watch. I am an owner of three different fitbits and have always been pleased but this one does NOT do the fitbit product line justice. It will not stay connected to my Bluetooth so I get no notifications at all. That is the main reason I wanted this particular watch.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth Groce

customer_reviews.title: Def Waterproof. I use it in the shower and ...
customer_reviews.text: Def Waterproof. I use it in the shower and pool. The only problem at this point is that the steps takes a moment to update/count. And for some reason it counts steps when I drive. The only way I found to prevent it is to turn off my Bluetooth on my phone, but sometimes I forget..
customer_reviews.author: Verna

customer_reviews.title: Face fell off and bad customer support.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved my Versa. But after only 6 months the screen fell off while o was simply watching TV on the sofa. When I contacted Fitbit to have it replaced as it was still under the one year warranty they refused and claimed that the screen coming off was not a defect or covered under warranty (even though other users had theirs replaced for the same problem). I am very disappointed in their customer support and even more disappointed that I had this watch for 6 months and it fell apart. That $250 I spent was wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch for about 15 months. The screen display is starting to die on me. It flickers back and forth (from pictures shown) and is not responsive to factory resets. Fitbit says their warranty on defective items ends at 1 year and won’t replace my defective item. DO NOT BUY. Other fitness watches have a 2 year warranty
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Jakubik

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit products are low quality
customer_reviews.text: You'll pay a lot and it will last about a year. For the price, you shouldn't have to buy one a year, they should last longer
customer_reviews.author: Fitness.Mom

customer_reviews.title: Better than Apple Watch. One watch, one app. Does everything!
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch!!!!! I struggled with choosing between this versus the Apple Watch. Definitely made the right decision. One watch with one app that does everything. I lift weights and do cardio. It easily tracks this and gives me notifications of texts, appts, emails, etc. I love the sleep tracker too. All in all, this watch is fabulous. Battery lasts 4 days and charges in the time you take a shower. Best purchase. Awesome price.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hatter

customer_reviews.title: Overall worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I love it 😍. The face size let’s me easily read the time without glasses. It’s cool that you can use your own pictures as a background. It’s sleek and light. Here are the buts: band is very hard to change, only one face let’s you review your steps, heart ♥️ rate and such.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Foster

customer_reviews.title: Never worked right, now it’s garbage
customer_reviews.text: Bought the versa, despite the bad reviews. Should not have gotten it. It’s been a little over a year since I’ve purchased it and now it’s garbage. Customer service would do nothing for me, since it’s been over a year. They do not fix devices, just replace them. I have always had trouble getting my versa to sync, and then my left button just stopped working. The device still worked but I did an update last week and it’s stuck on two screens. I cannot get to the main screen to see my stats, or watch face and cannot restart it. Therefore, I guess I’ll be buying something other than a Fitbit in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amber M.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Fitbit versa!! It works so great and I love how it tracks everything for me. I needed this to count my steps and calories as well as keep an eye on my sleep. The app is easy to use. I love that it vibrates a few times a day to remind you to move too. Really great especially for beginners on the whole fitness thing :)
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great watch overall
customer_reviews.text: The watch does not work as well with an iPhone as it does with an Android phone. I knew that beforehand and that was ok with me. However, the weather screen does not sync with my phone. I called customer support, we spent a lot of time resetting the watch, the weather screen synced when I was on the phone but it never did it again. I can make it sync but it is a very manual process and that is not how it is designed to work. I basically have given up on this feature.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: So many features!
customer_reviews.text: I'll give this 5 stars one I figure out why it has issues syncing. Having worn a FITBIT One for the past 6 years, it was time to upgrade as my One died peacefully while we slept. So many features that I still have to learn, but I LOVE how you can personalize it to your own style. You can also store up to 300 songs in the watch so you don't have to carry your phone during a workout.
customer_reviews.author: D. Barba

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and pair to telephone.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. I used Fitbit when they first came out but was dissatisfied with their products, bands cracked, trackers were not reliable and battery life was short. The Versa so far, has proven that products can improve. I love the color, rose gold, the fit and the face of the tracker. I haven’t experimented with any different faces but look forward to trying some.
customer_reviews.author: Mamalhe

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This fitbit is terrible. DO NOT purchase this. The battery life drains in less the 12 hours. I called customer service they sent me a replacement- that did the exact same thing. I called customer service again- they had me do a battery draining test- which my battery life didn't even last 12 hours, then said they would send me a discount to buy another fitbit. Why would I buy another fitbit if the first and second one I bought didn't even work. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit over Apple
customer_reviews.text: I love my versa! A lot of people ask if its an Apple Watch because they look so similar. I love the FitBit app also it’s very user friendly and the best part is that it tracks your sleep. I’ve had an Apple Watch and I would recommend a Fitbit over the apple.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: It does not count calories properly!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all. I purchased this fitbit Versa to count my calories and steps. I replaced the first one because it had me burning 1300 calories just by sitting at my desk. Now I have a replacement and so far within 4 hrs of connecting the new one I've burned 1510 calories. I'm very disappointed, I'll be returning the replacement as well.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: This Watch is AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Christmas and she loves it. Water resistant, she get texts and notifications on it with a heart rate and sleep tracker. She is even able to change the screen and add pictures plus the fitbit store has so many apps and tracking abilities. This is more cost efficient than spending hundreds of dollars on other watches.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Price

customer_reviews.title: Not really water resistant
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, the Versa was good. I fails miserably once it is exposed to water. 14 months in and its first exposure to water resulted in failure and no warranty. Disappointing. Fitbit offered a discount on a replacement. This is my second fitbit product and I dont think I will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Dreadn I

customer_reviews.title: Great smart watch!
customer_reviews.text: I was deciding between this, the apple watch, a Garmin, and a fossil watch. This was a great choice! Everyone thinks it's an apple watch, so looks-wise it's very sleek. The heart rate monitor is very fast and accurate! It's comfortable, easy to play my music on, read texts on, etc. The only thing I don't love is the app. I still like the food tracker better on my fitness pal and they don't sync well for me. Just a personal preference. I would highly suggest this watch for both new smart watch users and old faithfuls!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this Fitbit. I’ve been eyeing it for a year and finally bought it. The battery life is long. The charger came and rattled a bit but it works so there’s that. Putting on the bands (which it comes with a small and large) IS NOT EASY!! aside from that I love this Fitbit
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: if you have a Apple I Phone you CAN Not use quick replies!! Only with Android!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to see text messages and Phone calls while at work. But I can only see text I cannot reply with an I Phone!!!! When I read the features it said you can use with Iphone. But you can only see them not reply to them!!!! I will not buy another fitbit product. I wish I would have bought the Apple Watch It is not Accurate At All for the steps!!!! While at work when I am blowdrying clients it counts my arm movements as steps!!! You do not take anywhere near the steps it tells you've taken !!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died after one year and one month
customer_reviews.text: Two months ago if you would have asked me to rate this product I would have given it a 5/5. But last week my fitbit randomly stopped working. This was one year and one month after my purchase date and the fitbit company could not do anything for me since my one year warranty was up. I would not recommend this watch if you are looking for a long lasting watch. I am beyond upset that I have to purchase a new one after just one year of having it and will not be purchasing the fitbit again. I will be buying an apple watch this time.
customer_reviews.author: CSeuferer

product_meta.title: Fitbit Versa Smart Watch, Peach/Rose Gold Aluminium, One Size (S & L Bands Included)
product_meta.description: Live your best life with the Fitbit Versa family of health and fitness smartwatches. The Versa Lite Edition includes core fitness and smart features like activity, sleep and heart rate tracking, notifications, apps and 4+ day battery life—plus bold color choices and an easy one button design. Fitbit Versa includes all the features of Lite Edition plus music, on screen workouts, floors climbed and swim lap tracking. Finally, the Versa Special Edition includes all the features of Versa, plus a special woven band and on the go payments with Fitbit Pay.
feature_bullets: Includes all versa lite edition features plus: store and play 300 plus songs, utilize on screen workouts that play on your wrist and coach you through every move and track swim laps and floors climbed

Track your all day activity, 24/7 heart rate, & sleep stages, all with a 4 plus day battery life (varies with use and other factors) and a slim, comfortable design with a lightweight, anodized aluminum watch body. Syncs with MAC OS x 10.6 and up, iPhone 4s and later, iPad 3 gen. And later, android 5.0 and later and windows 10 devices. Syncing range: up to 6.1 meters
Use 15 plus exercise modes like run or swim (Fitbit versa is water resistant to 50 meters) to record workouts and connect to Smartphone GPS for more precise real time pace & distance
Access your favorite apps for sports, weather & more and get called, calendar, text, and app alerts
Get call, text, calendar and smartphone app notifications when your phone is nearby. Plus send quick replies on android only
Automatically track select sports & workouts with smarttrack and use female health tracking in the fitbit app to log periods, symptoms and more
